clickToRestore.message: Left click to open the menu. Click the middle button to restore the '$name$' session in a new window, ctrl-click (Windows, Linux) or cmd-click (Mac) in the current window

confirmClose.message: Open this session and close current window(s)? (Cannot undo!)

confirmDeleteQuestion.message: Are you sure you want to remove this session?

emptySession.message: No window is selected in this session

enterSessionName.message: Please enter the name of the session

exportedSessionCopyTips.message: Ctrl+c or Cmd+c to copy your session

minutes.message:
Recommended: 5 minutes. Auto-saving too
frequently may slow down your machine.

optionsBackupPeriod.message: Saves all your windows and tabs every

optionsBackupPeriodOutOfRange.message: Backup period cannot be shorter than 1 minute or larger than 999 minutes

optionsReorder.message: Move session to top after edit

restoreSession2.message: Click to open session in new window

saveFail.message: Fail to save session. Please try again later

saveSessionButtonDescription.message: Click here to save this as a new MySessions session

msHeadingNewTitle.message: You can drag and drop tabs between windows

msSaveList.message: Uncheck tabs that you don't want to be saved.

snapshotHint.message: Session snapshots that are saved in an earlier use of Firefox.

LeftSequentiallyMiddleTogether.message: Left click will open the tabs sequentially, middle click will open the tabs together.

optionsShowAutoSave.message: Show autosaved sessions in the session list.

optionsShowPopap.message: Show a pop-up window (in a new tab) when updating.

optionsMarkAll.message: Mark all open windows for saving (otherwise - only active).

attention1.message: Attention! It is recommended to save the settings again after each update of the add-on. This will protect you from some bugs.

attention2.message: Attention! It is recommended that you periodically keep a backup of your bookmarks in the bookmark manager and save it in a safe place (cloud). This will protect you from losing sessions in the event of force majeure.

optionsDisableConfirmation.message: Disable confirmation to delete the session (not recommended).

stringSortTitle.message:
You can store frequently used sessions at the top of the list using prefixes.
For example: "1. Session1", "2. Session2", "A. Session3", etc.

optionsListURL.message: Export sessions as a list of URLs.

optionsEnablecolorIcon.message: Select the color of the icon.

Privacy.message: This setting may violate your privacy (more).

optionsShowFaviconTab.message: Do not show warning tab when updating an extension.

optionsDiscarded.message: Enable the "discarded" property for tabs when opening a session.

optionsDiscarded1.message: This option will work in FF63 and older (https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1378647).

optionsDiscarded2.message: In the version FF63 and later this option disables the option above (lazy loading tabs).

optionsDiscarded3.message: In the version of FF62 and earlier, the inclusion of this option has no effect.

optionsDiscarded4.message: You can see how it works https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZodZxpQRNsg & https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OKyG1_AXAxI

optionsEnableCloseWindow.message: Save session when closing window, maximum number

Description.message: A simple session manager. You can quickly save your current browser state and reload it whenever necessary. This is not a replacement for Michael Kraft's "Session Manager", but it allows you to import saved sessions from the "Session Manager".

MainThing.message:
The main task of this extension is to save sessions at any cost. As a repository, browser bookmarks are selected as the most reliable and secure storage.

Please note that in the Firefox version of this extension to resolve tab icons the following service is used: "https://icons.duckduckgo.com/ip3/{Domains_URL_of_a_tab}.ico".
We don't collect cookies, password, e-mails or any other confidential info.
Only domains (not full URLs) of the websites visited (if you allow) and nothing else.

You can import your sessions from the "Session Manager" from Michael Kraft https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BspF2LhngDs

This extension uses bookmarks. If you actively use bookmarks, this extension messes your bookmark search.
The extension does not work in a private window, but a private session can be saved from a regular (non-private) window.
I repeat: this is not a replacement for the "Session Manager" from Michael Kraft. Rather, it is the Session Keeper with the possibility of their recovery.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UgZFxV4cfuU

You can help with localization https://crowdin.com/project/mysession

Vote on Mozilla website for APIs/bug fixes needed by session managers, so they can be better. https://www.reddit.com/r/firefox/comments/7m8nvx/can_session_manager_tab_session_manager_coexist/drslt43/

optionsShowHidden.message: Display in the list of tabs and save hidden tabs.

optionsHidden1.message: This option is added for compatibility with extensions that use tab hiding, such as "Simple Tab Groups" and others.

optionsHidden3.message: ATTENTION! Do not press the button "Close hidden tabs" if you have extensions that use tab hiding. This can lead to data loss.

closetext.message: ||local storage|| Sessions snapshots when closing the window

optionsEnableSaveFile.message: Save backup to file, save path

optionSaveFile.message: When browser starts up, create a backup file of sessions and save it in the download folder. Specify the folder to save the backup file. The save location is limited to the folder under browser download folder.

optionsDisableConfirm.message: Disable confirmation when opening a session in the current window (not recommended).

optionPermissions.message: To use backing up sessions to a file, you must enable the permission "Download files and read and modify the browser’s download history"

snapshotHint2.message: Sessions snapshots when closing the window.

AlertPermissions.message: You have the option "Save backup to file" enabled, for this option to work, you need to enable the permission "Download files, read and change browser download history", otherwise - disable the option.

WARNING.message:
WARNING!!!

To work with this module, you must enable the permission "Download files and read and modify the browser’s download history" !!!

- First of all, back up your bookmarks in the bookmark manager and save it in a safe place. Possible bugs.

- When deleting one or several sessions, a file is created with sessions deleted in the default save path (usually C:\Users\\Downloads). You can delete this file at any time, or restore the session from it in case of an erroneous deletion. I do not plan to allow users to disable this feature.

- For those who actively use bookmarks: You can backup all sessions to a file, delete them from storage, use bookmarks in the usual mode. At any moment you can restore one or several sessions from a file.

- Send suggestions, comments, error messages in

optionsPopupNewTab.message: Open the extension popup in a new tab.
